descript.abstract: The three Metro Vancouver Watersheds (Capilano, Seymour & Coquitlam) are the source of the Region's drinking water supply.Seymour Watershed boundary was updated to the Height of Land as originally defined by the 2017 LiDAR contractor. The adjoining boundary with Capilano Watershed was accordingly updated. Changes were approved were approved by Watershed Management - January 2019. Watershed Boundary line and polygon feature classes match each other.
descript.purpose: The three Metro Vancouver Watersheds (Capilano, Seymour & Coquitlam) are the source of the Region's drinking water supply. The activities associated with Watershed Operations include drainage and erosion control, watershed road network management, vegetation management and the provision of monitoring and support services for Metro Vancouver's operations, construction and planning work groups for the watersheds. Watershed Operations activities are based on the five Watershed Principles, the strategic level Watershed Management Plan and implementation plans. Seymour Watershed boundary was updated to the Height of Land as originally defined by the 2017 LiDAR contractor. The adjoining boundary with Capilano Watershed was accordingly updated.

idinfo.useconst: "See the GVRD Data Sharing Agreement for Disclaimer and Warranties and Limitation on Liabilities with respect to the data." · The data may not be copied, sold, or redistributed without the written consent of the GVRD. · The data may be used in publications, reports, and the like provided that the GVRD is acknowledged as the source of the data.
